JobTitle: Lead Analyst, Strategic Projects and Initiatives for National M&A Services
JobFullDesc: Lead Analyst, Strategic Projects and Initiatives for National M&A Services Description  M&A Services (MAS) is a Strategic Growth Offering (SGO) that spans all four of Deloitte's functional businesses. The National M&A Services team supports the cross-functional MAS leadership team by leading and executing strategic projects and initiatives that support our strategy and growth ambition. We play a key role in providing connectivity and building engagement across our complex, multifaceted practice. Our team seeks an experienced and energetic Analyst-level professional with outstanding communication, analytical and project management skills to join our team. Location is flexible, although Boston, Austin or Tri- State are preferred. Minimal travel required. Work you'll do:  Conduct quantitative and qualitative research and analysis in support of key initiatives; e.g., work closely with the finance team on data analysis, including financial, client, and market data to identify opportunities and trends   Provide support for MAS-wide tracking and coordination related to our market share and cross- functional mega-deal participation   Work closely with other members of the MAS national team to execute complex, high-visibility efforts such as our biennial PPMD Leadership Summit   Support communications, both within MAS and across Deloitte, to increase awareness of our client & firm impact   Assist in the development of materials for MAS leadership meetings   Work with MAS leadership team on special projects and presentations as needed  Qualifications To be successful in this role, you'll need:  Strong analytical skills; ability to determine data needs and approaches to inform decision-making   Strong organizational skills, ability to work on multiple projects and with multiple stakeholders at once, appropriately prioritizing and managing time   Excellent written and oral communication skills; executive presence and ability to interact with professionals at all levels of our organization   High level of proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, and Word; an eye for telling the story and conveying information in a visually appealing way   A proactive work ethic ("self-starter") that also embraces a collaborative ("team player") approach   Flexibility, persistence, and creativity in finding solutions   Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn   Outstanding attention to detail  Required capabilities:  Bachelor's degree, with preference for a business-related (e.g., Finance, Economics) or a technical discipline.   3+ years of prior relevant experience in client-facing or internal roles within professional services organization such as Deloitte.   Flexible work style with possible travel (approx. 10%). A US-based office location is required.   Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.  Additional desired qualifications:  Knowledge of the M&A and Restructuring market and Deloitte's M&A practice   Familiarity with external data and research sources such as Mergerstat, Thomson, Hoovers, etc.   Familiarity with excel macros and VBA
